question:
What is the transfer of files from the internet to your computer called?

RRB JE 14/12/2014
solution:
• Downloading refers to the process of transferring files from the internet or a remote server to your computer.
  • It means receiving data from the internet onto your local device.
  • Downloading is the opposite of uploading, where files are sent from your computer to the internet or another server.

Additional Information:

  • Uploading is the process of sending files from your computer to the internet.
  • FTP (File Transfer Protocol) is a protocol used for transferring files between computers but is not the name of the action itself.
  • JPEG is an image file format, unrelated to the file transfer process.

question:
Which of the following best describes- ‘A method of storing and transmitting data in a particular coded form so that only those can read and process it for whom it is intended. It includes encoding and decoding of data’?

RRB NTPC Stage-I 11/02/2021 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The described method is Cryptography, which is the practice of storing and transmitting data in a coded form.
  • It ensures that only the intended recipients can read and process the data through encoding (encryption) and decoding (decryption).
  • Cryptography is fundamental for secure communication, data privacy, and protecting sensitive information.

Additional Information:

  • Blockchain is a distributed ledger technology but not directly about encoding/decoding data for privacy.
  • Programming refers to writing code to create software, not specifically about coded data transmission.
  • Cloud computing is about storing and accessing data over the internet, not about encrypting it.

question:
A process material is used for the use of the word password on the internet so that the word password is not easily blocked, it is called as-

RRB JE 14/12/2014
solution:
• The process described is called Coding, which means transforming information (like the word "password") into a different form to protect or obscure it.
  • Coding ensures that sensitive words or data are not easily readable or blocked by unauthorized users or systems.
  • It is a basic step in data security and communication to prevent misuse.

Additional Information:

  • Code word is a specific word used for secret communication but not the process itself.
  • Malware is malicious software designed to harm or exploit systems.
  • Virus is a type of malware that replicates and spreads to damage systems.

question:
Between different tips, it is called the system of numerical rules for the processing and exchange of data.

RRB JE 14/12/2014 (Shift-I)
solution:
• The correct term for a system of numerical rules for processing and exchanging data is an Algorithm.
  • An algorithm is a step-by-step procedure or set of rules designed to perform a specific task, especially in data processing.
  • It defines how data is processed, transformed, and exchanged between systems.

Additional Information:

  • Process material order is not a standard term in computing or data processing.
  • Message idea is vague and does not describe a system of numerical rules.
  • Information resources refer to data and tools used for processing but not the rules themselves.

question:
Which of the following is an example of internet service provider?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• An Internet Service Provider (ISP) is a company that provides users access to the Internet.
  • Airtel is an ISP that offers internet connectivity through broadband, fiber, and mobile data services.

Additional Information:

  • Mozilla is a web browser developer (e.g., Firefox).
  • Google is a tech company offering search engines, email, cloud services, etc., but it is not an ISP.
  • Outlook is an email service, not an internet provider.

question:
Which of the following is NOT a type of communication on the internet?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Telepathy is a fictional or supernatural concept and not a real method of communication on the internet.
  • The internet supports communication through chat, video conferencing, and email .
  • These are all digital and technological modes of real communication.

Additional Information:

  • Chat allows real-time text messaging over the internet.
  • Email is a standard way to send written messages and attachments.
  • Video conferencing enables face-to-face interaction via webcam and microphone.

question:
Which of the following is the advantage of using an Electronic mail?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: An overwhelming number of emails can lead to information overload.
option_2: Vulnerability to spam and phishing threats.
option_3: It is convenient and fast communication with individuals or groups globally.
option_4: It can lead to decreased face-to-face communication and loss of personal touch.
solution:
• The main advantage of using email is that it enables fast and convenient communication globally , with both individuals and large groups.
  • Emails can be sent and received instantly , saving time and cost compared to physical mail.
  • Attachments, links, and records of communication make email highly efficient.

Additional Information:

  • Other options listed are disadvantages of email, such as spam, information overload, and reduced personal interaction.
  • However, the speed, accessibility, and cost-effectiveness of email make it widely used in personal and professional life.
  • Email is especially useful for business communication, remote work, and documentation .

question:
What is the main objective of the Inbox within an email mailbox?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: To schedule email reminders
option_2: To store received emails
option_3: To use as trash can
option_4: To manage contacts and address book
solution:
• The Inbox in an email mailbox is used to store all incoming or received emails.
  • It acts as the default location where new messages arrive.
  • Users can read, reply to, ororganise emails directly from the inbox.

Additional Information:

  • Trash stores deleted emails.
  • Contacts/Address Book holds email addresses and user information.
  • Reminders and scheduling are handled through calendars or other tools, not the inbox.

question:
What is the role of routers in Internet architecture?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: To connect devices to the Internet
option_2: To provide security for Internet connections
option_3: To translate IP addresses into domain names
option_4: To receive and send data on computer networks.
solution:
• Routers are networking devices that receive and forward data packets between computer networks.
  • They determine the best path for data to travel from source to destination over the Internet.
  • Routers enable communication between devices across different networks .

Additional Information:

  • Modems connect devices to the Internet, not routers alone.
  • Firewalls provide security, not routers specifically.
  • DNS servers translate IP addresses into domain names, not routers.

question:
What do you mean by LAN?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• LAN (Local Area Network) refers to a network that connects computers and devices within a limited area , such as a home, office, or school.
  • It is commonly used for file sharing, printer access, and internet sharing among connected devices.
  • LANs are usually faster and more secure within a small physical range.

Additional Information:

  • LAN is different from WAN (Wide Area Network) , which covers broader geographical areas.
  • Devices on a LAN are typically connected using Ethernet cables or Wi-Fi .
  • Examples: Office networks, school computer labs, home Wi-Fi.

question:
Which is used when the sender doesn't want others to know someone else was copied in email?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) is used when the sender wants to send a copy of the email to someone without other recipients knowing .
  • Recipients listed in the BCC field are hidden from all other recipients.
  • This is useful for confidential communication or sending to a large group discreetly.

Additional Information:

  • CC (Carbon Copy) shows all copied recipients to everyone.
  • To is for primary recipients.
  • From indicates the sender’s email address, not recipients.

question:
Files included with email are commonly referred to as ____________.

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Files or documents sent along with an email are called attachments .
  • These can include PDFs, Word documents, Excel sheets, images, videos , etc.
  • Attachments are typically added using the paperclip icon in the email compose window.

Additional Information:

  • Add-ons are external tools or plugins, not files.
  • Supplements refer to additional information, not in technical email terms.
  • Appends means to add content, but not used for files in email context.

question:
Which organisation standardises technologies for World Wide Web?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The World Wide Web Consortium (W3C) is the main international standardsorganisation that oversees the development andstandardisation of web technologies , including HTML, CSS, XML , and more.
  • It ensures that the web remains open, accessible, and interoperable across all platforms and browsers.
  • W3C was founded by Tim Berners-Lee , the inventor of the World Wide Web.

Additional Information:

  • WHO (World Health Organization) is responsible for international public health.
  • IEEE (Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers) standardisestechnologies related to electronics and communication, not web-specific.
  • IEIT is not arecognised standards organisation for the web.

question:
What is the purpose of spellcheck in email composition?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: To format the email text
option_2: To add attachments to the email
option_3: To check for and correct spelling errors
option_4: To translate the email into another language
solution:
• The purpose of spellcheck during email composition is to identify and correct spelling mistakes in the written text.
  • It helps improve the accuracy and professionalism of the message.
  • Most email clients underline misspelled words and suggest corrections automatically.

Additional Information:

  • Spellcheck does not translate content or add formatting or attachments.
  • It is especially useful in formal communication , preventing embarrassing typos.

question:
Which of the following is NOT an example of Instant Messaging in Internet?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Instant Messaging (IM) refers to platforms that enable real-time communication between users.
  • WhatsApp , Telegram , and Discord all provide instant, real-time chatting features .
  • Email is not considered instant messaging as it is asynchronous —the sender and receiver do not need to be online at the same time.

Additional Information:

  • Email is a form of electronic mail used for more formal or long-form communication .
  • Instant Messaging is used for quick, ongoing interactions , often with presence indicators (online/offline).
  • IM is common in personal chats, team collaboration, and gaming .

question:
In email, addresses are separated by which symbol when sent to multiple people?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_2: At the rate of
solution:
• When an email is sent to multiple recipients , their email addresses are separated by commas( , ) in the To , CC , or BCC fields.
  • This ensures each address isrecognised correctly and the message is sent to all intended recipients.
  • Some email clients also accept semicolons (;) depending on regional settings.

Additional Information:

  • @ is part of the email address itself, not a separator.
  • The paper clip icon represents attachments.
  • Equal sign (=) has no role in separating email addresses.

question:
What is the purpose of the CC field in an email?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: It stands for ‘Copy Contents’ and is used to copy and paste text into the email.
option_2: It stands for ‘Closed Captioning’ and is used to add subtitles to the email.
option_3: It stands for ‘Courtesy Copy’ and is used to send a polite message along with the email.
option_4: It stands for ‘Carbon Copy’ and is used to include additional recipients who should be informed about the email.
solution:
• In email communication, CC stands for Carbon Copy .
  • It allows you to send the same message to additional recipients apart from the main recipient.
  • CC recipients are visible to all other recipients of the email.

Additional Information:

  • Use BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) if you want to hide recipients’ email addresses.
  • CC is useful in professional emails when others need to stay informed but are not the main audience.
  • The term originates from carbon paper copies used in typewriters.

question:
Which of the following is the correct full form of VOIP?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Volume over internet protocol
option_2: Voice over intranet protocol
option_3: Voice over internet protocol
option_4: Voice of intranet protocol
solution:
• VOIP stands for Voice over Internet Protocol .
  • It allows voice communication and multimedia sessions over the internet , rather than through traditional telephone lines.
  • VOIP is used in services like Skype, WhatsApp, Zoom , etc.

Additional Information:

  • VOIP converts voice into digital signals that travel over the internet.
  • It is cost-effective , especially for long-distance or international calls.
  • Requires an internet connection and compatible device or software.

question:
Protocol used for sending and receiving emails between servers?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP)
option_3: Hyper Text Transfer Protocol (HTTP)
solution:
• SMTP (Simple Mail Transfer Protocol) is the standard protocol used to send emails from one server to another .
  • It works with POP3 or IMAP to allow email clients to receive messages.
  • SMTP is responsible for transferring outgoing mail from client to server or between mail servers.

Additional Information:

  • FTP is used for file transfers, not email.
  • HTTP is used for web browsing.
  • TCP is a transport protocol and supports all of them but is not specific to email.

question:
Folder for unsolicited/junk emails sent in bulk?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The Spam folder is specifically designed to store unsolicited and bulk email , commonly known as junk or spam mail .
  • These emails are often sent for advertising, phishing, or malware purposes.
  • Email services use filters to detect and automatically move such messages to the spam folder.

Additional Information:

  • Outbox : Temporarily holds emails waiting to be sent.
  • Inbox : Stores received emails.
  • Draft : Stores incomplete or unsent email compositions.

question:
Which is NOT a layer of TCP/IP suite?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The TCP/IP model consists of four layers: Network Interface , Internet , Transport , and Application .
  • There is no separate “Physical layer” in TCP/IP; physical transmission details are included within the Network Interface layer.
  • Physical layer is specific to the OSI model and not defined separately in TCP/IP.

Additional Information:

  • The Internet layer in TCP/IP roughly corresponds to the Network layer in OSI terminology.
  • TCP/IP groups Data Link and Physical functionalities together under Network Interface .
  • The four-layer model simplifies protocol design by combining lower-level functionalities.

question:
What can be an attachment in email?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Email attachments allow you to include files of various types, such as digital photos (JPEG, PNG) and documents (PDF, DOCX) , alongside your message.
  • The attachment function supports multimedia and data files , enabling transfer of images, text documents, spreadsheets, and more.
  • Attachments are encoded (e.g., Base64) and sent as part of the email payload , ensuring recipients can download and view them.

Additional Information:

  • Common attachment size limits vary by email provider (e.g., around 25MB in Gmail).
  • You can attach multiple files in a single email using the paperclip icon or drag-and-drop.
  • Some services offer cloud links when file sizes exceed limits, converting large attachments into shareable links.

question:
Foundation of data communication on the web?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• HTTP is the underlying protocol used by web browsers and servers to request and deliver web page resources (HTML, images, scripts).
  • It operates over TCP/IP , defining methods like GET , POST , PUT , and DELETE for data operations.
  • HTTP is stateless , meaning each request is independent, which simplifies communication.

Additional Information:

  • The World Wide Web is the system of interlinked documents, not the transfer protocol itself.
  • A Domain Name Server (DNS) translates domain names to IP addresses but does not transport web content.
  • A URL specifies the address of a resource but relies on HTTP (or HTTPS) to fetch it.

question:
Application for exchanging messages between users?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Email is an application that allows users to compose, send, receive, and store messages electronically over computer networks.
  • It supports instant delivery , attachments, and address lists, making it ideal for both personal and professional communication.
  • Email systems can be accessed via desktop clients , web interfaces , or mobile apps .

Additional Information:

  • Bing and Chrome are search engines and web browsers, respectively, not messaging applications.
  • Mozilla (e.g., Firefox) is a web browser, not designed for direct message exchange.
  • Email uses protocols like SMTP , IMAP , and POP3 to manage message transfer and storage.

question:
Main purpose of a search engine?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_2: Finding information on the internet
solution:
• A search engine indexes billions ofweb pages and retrieves relevant ones based on user queries.
  • It uses algorithms to rank results by relevance, authority, and freshness.
  • The primary role is to help users quickly locate information across the vast resources of the internet.

Additional Information:

  • Popular search engines include Google , Bing , and DuckDuckGo .
  • They employ web crawlers (bots) to scan and update their searchable index.
  • Beyond web pages, they also offer images, videos, news , maps, and more specialized search features.

question:
Icon used for attaching a file in email?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The paper clip icon is the standard symbol across most email clients for attaching files to a message.
  • It is usually located in the compose window toolbar , often near send and formatting options.
  • Clicking the paper clip icon opens a file browser , allowing you to select documents, images, or other files to attach.

Additional Information:

  • Other icons serve different functions: the trash can deletes, the pen edits or composes, and the smiley inserts emojis.
  • Many email clients also support drag-and-drop file attachment, but the paper clip remains the universal manual attachment tool.
  • Hovering over the paper clip often displays a tooltip like “Attach file” or “Insert attachment.”

question:
Private network open to external parties like partners?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• An Extranet is a private network that uses internet technologies to share part of an organization’s information or operations with external stakeholders like partners and suppliers.
  • It provides secure access via authentication mechanisms, ensuring only authorized external users can connect.
  • Extranets facilitate collaboration and information exchange without exposing the entire internal network.

Additional Information:

  • In contrast, an Intranet is restricted to internal employees only.
  • The Internet is a public global network accessible by anyone.
  • Telnet is a protocol for remote access, not a network type.

question:
Purpose of the CC field in email?

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_1: To indicate that the email is of high importance
option_2: To include additional recipients who should be kept informed
option_3: To request a read receipt from the recipient
option_4: To encrypt the email for added security
solution:
• The CC (Carbon Copy) field lets you send a copy of the email to secondary recipients , so they stay in the loop without being the primary addressees.
  • All recipients (To and CC) can see who else received the message, ensuring transparency in communication.
  • CC is useful in professional contexts to keep managers, team members, or stakeholders informed without addressing the email directly to them.

Additional Information:

  • Use BCC (Blind Carbon Copy) when you want to hide certain recipients from others.
  • Overusing CC can clutter inboxes; include only those who truly need visibility.
  • Email etiquette often suggests keeping CC lists concise and relevant.

question:
Address used on the World Wide Web to access a specific resource (URL)

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• A Uniform Resource Locator (URL) is the address on the World Wide Web used to access specific resources.
  • It defines the protocol (e.g., http:// or https://) and the exact path to the resource on the host server.
  • URLs allow browsers and other applications to retrieve web pages, images, files, and services by pointing directly to their location.

Additional Information:

  • A URL consists of a scheme , host , optional port , path , query string , and fragment identifier .
  • A Hyperlink is clickable text or an element that references a URL but is not itself the URL.
  • Web server refers to the system that hosts and delivers web content, while Web pages are the documents accessed via URLs.

question:
Internet technique using modem to dial an ISP (Dial-up connection)

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
option_2: Integrated Services Digital Network (ISDN) Service
solution:
• This technique is known as (Dial-up Connection).
  • The computer’s modem dials a telephone number provided by the ISP to establish an Internet link.
  • Typical speeds max out around 56 Kbps and the connection is established on demand.

Additional Information:

  • ISDN (Integrated Services Digital Network) uses digitalsignalling over telephone lines and offers higher, always-on speeds via B and D channels.
  • (Broadband) such as DSL or cable provides an always-on high-speed link without dialing.
  • DSL (Digital Subscriber Line) runs over standard copper telephone lines but does not require a dial-up process and offers much higher bandwidth.

question:
Service to buy/sell products online

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• E-commerce allows users to buy and sell products online .
  • It includes platforms like Amazon , eBay , and Shopify .
  • Transactions use secure payment gateways such as PayPal and credit cards .

Additional Information:

  • Video conferencing facilitates real-time audio/video communication .
  • Instant messaging provides real-time text communication .
  • Streaming refers to continuous media delivery over the internet .

question:
ISP stands for __ in internet architecture

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• ISP stands for Internet Service Provider , theorganisation that supplies internet access.
  • ISPs connect homes and businesses to the global internet via technologies like DSL , fiber , or cable .
  • They assign you an IP address and manage your data traffic to and from the internet.

Additional Information:

  • ISPs often offer bundled services such as email , web hosting , and security packages.
  • Popular examples include Airtel , BSNL , Comcast , and Verizon .
  • Unlike a protocol , which defines communication rules, an ISP is a service provider company.

question:
Sharing internet via mobile hotspot

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Tethering uses a smartphone’s mobile data connection to share internet access with other devices.
  • It can be set up via USB , Bluetooth , or Wi-Fi hotspot on your phone.
  • Ideal for on-the-go connectivity when traditional Wi-Fi isn’t available.

Additional Information:

  • Wi-Fi hotspot tethering typically offers the fastest speeds among tethering methods.
  • USB tethering provides a stable connection and charges the phone simultaneously.
  • Bluetooth tethering uses less battery but has slower data rates.

question:
Global network of interconnected devices

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• Internet is the global system of interconnected computer networks that use the TCP/IP protocol suite to communicate.
  • It links billions of devices worldwide, enabling services like web browsing , email , and streaming .
  • Governed by standards such as RFC 791 (IP) and RFC 793 (TCP) for reliable data exchange.

Additional Information:

  • Ethernet refers to wired LAN technology, not the global Internet.
  • Intranet is a private network within an organization that uses Internet technologies but is not publicly accessible.
  • MANET (Mobile Ad Hoc Network) is a self-configuring wireless network of mobile devices.

question:
Internet architecture layer responsible for routing packets

SSC Delhi Police Constable – 2023
solution:
• The Network layer is responsible for routing packets between different networks.
  • It uses logical addressing (IP addresses) to determine the best path for data.
  • In the OSI model it’s Layer 3; in the TCP/IP model it’s called the Internet layer .

Additional Information:

  • The Data Link layer (Layer 2) handles local frame delivery on the same network segment.
  • The Transport layer (Layer 4) provides end-to-end communication and error correction.
  • The Application layer (Layer 7) offers user-facing services like HTTP and SMTP.
